did.unittitle: CIO Minutes of the Executive Board on Microfilm, 1935-1955
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library

bioghist.p: The Congress of Industrial Organizations (CIO), proposed by John L. Lewis in 1928, was a federation of unions that organized workers in industrial unions in the United States and Canada from 1935 to 1955. The CIO merged with the American Federation of Labor to form the AFL-CIO in 1955.

accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.p: CIO Minutes of the Executive Board on Microfilm #5947 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
